ul.li1: 181 He who is selfish seeks a craving;Or “boundary”
ul.li2: against all sound judgment he shows contempt.
ul.li1: 2A fool will not take pleasure in understanding,
ul.li2: but in expressing his heart.Or “mind”
ul.li1: 3With the coming of wickedness comes contempt also,
ul.li2: and with dishonor, disgrace.
ul.li1: 4Deep waters are words of the mouth of a man;
ul.li2: a gushing stream is a fountain of wisdom.
ul.li1: 5Being partial to faces of evil is not good,
ul.li2: nor to subvert the righteous at the judgment.
ul.li1: 6The lips of a fool will bring strife,
ul.li2: and his mouth calls out for a flogging.
ul.li1: 7The mouth of a fool is ruin to him,
ul.li2: and his lips are a snare to his soul.Or “life,” or “inner self”
ul.li1: 8The words of a whisper are like delicious morsels,
ul.li2: and they themselves go down to inner parts of the body.
ul.li1: 9Even he who is slack in his work,
ul.li2: he is brother to a masterOr “owner” of destruction.
ul.li1: 10A tower of strength is the name of Yahweh;
ul.li2: into himOr “it” the righteous will run and be safe.
ul.li1: 11The wealth of the rich is his strong city,Literally “a city of his strength”
ul.li2: and like a wall, it is high in his imagination.
ul.li1: 12In the presence of destruction, the heartOr “mind” of a man will be haughty,
ul.li2: but in the presence of honor, humble.
ul.li1: 13He who returns a word before he will hear,
ul.li2: folly itself belongs to him as well asHebrew “and” shame.
ul.li1: 14The spirit of a man will endure his sickness,
ul.li2: but a broken spirit, who may bear it?
ul.li1: 15An intelligent mindLiterally “heart” will acquire knowledge,
ul.li2: and the ear of the wise will seek knowledge.
ul.li1: 16The gift of a person will open doors for him,
ul.li2: and before the great, it gives him access.
ul.li1: 17The first in his dispute is deemed righteous,
ul.li2: but his neighbor will come and examine him.
ul.li1: 18The lot will put an end to disputes,
ul.li2: and between powerful contenders it will decide.
ul.li1: 19A brother who is offended is worse than a city of strength,
ul.li2: and quarrels are like the bars of a fortification.
ul.li1: 20From the fruit of a man’s mouth, his stomach will be satisfied,
ul.li2: as for the yield of his lips, it will satisfy.
ul.li1: 21Death and life are in the powerLiterally “hand” of the tongue,
ul.li2: and those who love herThat is, the power of the tongue will eat of her fruit.
ul.li1: 22He who finds a wifeOr “woman” finds good,
ul.li2: and he will obtain favor from Yahweh.
ul.li1: 23The poor may speak entreaties,
ul.li2: but the rich will answer roughly.
ul.li1: 24A man of many friends will come to ruin,
ul.li2: but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
